posts.post_content: [Aurelia's Fury](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aurelia's Fury) is getting all the ink, but this card actually seems better to me. Even if you just nail your opponent and one of his creature for a wad of damage, that's great. It's like a [Profane Command](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Profane Command) in green. But if you can manage your opponent and two of his creatures? Shoot, that's like [Bonfire of the Damned](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bonfire of the Damned) off miracle.

Posted By: wholelottalove (1/29/2013 8:16:24 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A beautiful amalgamation of two timeless cards from Alpha, [Earthquake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Earthquake) and [Hurricane](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hurricane).  
  
I actually expected this card to have a higher rating. *(Currently it's around 3.75)*  
  
You always get to target any creature (since it's bound to either have or not have flying) *as well as a* player, in addition there's the chance of even hitting a *third* target!  
  
And still you can choose to only hit one target, in case targeting the others comes with a drawback, or if there isn't a creature out there to choose from.  
Also it's worth noting that targets do in no way require to be related - in multiplayer, you could target player A, a creature from player B and even your own creature!  
  
A very dynamic and interesting burn spell, and overall great design!
posts.html:
A beautiful amalgamation of two timeless cards from Alpha, Earthquake and Hurricane.

I actually expected this card to have a higher rating. (Currently it's around 3.75)

You always get to target any creature (since it's bound to either have or not have flying) as well as a player, in addition there's the chance of even hitting a third target!

And still you can choose to only hit one target, in case targeting the others comes with a drawback, or if there isn't a creature out there to choose from.
Also it's worth noting that targets do in no way require to be related - in multiplayer, you could target player A, a creature from player B and even your own creature!

A very dynamic and interesting burn spell, and overall great design!
